thread.title: Famke Janssen would love to star in a UK show: 'Absolutely Fabulous is still one of my favourites' - TV
thread.title_full: Famke Janssen would love to star in a UK show: 'Absolutely Fabulous is still one of my favourites' - TV News - Digital Spy

author: Tom Eames
title: Famke Janssen would love to star in a UK show: 'Absolutely Fabulous is still one of my favourites' - TV
text: © Ernesto Di Stefano Photography/WireImage Famke Janssen has spoken of her love for UK television, and how she would jump at the chance to appear in a British show."There's so much good TV right now, a lot of it is coming out of the UK now too," the X-Men star told Digital Spy. "I thought Utopia was really smart, but there's so many."There's just too much content to the point where I can't keep up with any shows! When do I have time to watch this stuff? It's exciting because there's so many more opportunities for us creative people."When asked if she would like to film a UK show, she said: "I would, yeah. Just because I think the writing is very clever. America is constantly looking at the UK and doing their versions." © Fox Searchlight Pictures/BBC Films Famke is also a big fan of a particular British sitcom which will soon release its first movie spinoff."Absolutely Fabulous is still one of my favourite shows of all time," she revealed. "I'm obsessed with those women, obsessed! I'll be the first one to buy a ticket."The actress has joined season two of How to Get Away with Murder as Eve, a former lover of Viola Davis's Annalise Keating. She explained that she is proud to be part of a "groundbreaking" storyline. © ABC "I'm a very big fan of Viola Davis, I think she's a very powerful, strong and unique actress," Janssen said. "I just love supporting shows with strong female protagonists, it's really important."I think the storyline particularly on a network show is groundbreaking on certain levels. Because of the relationship between the two characters. So I'm very pleased to be part of that."How to Get Away with Murder's second season starts on Wednesday, October 28 at 9pm on Universal Channel in the UK. Watch a trailer below:
